TOY¶

Model of snake cube: a toy made of strips of cubelets that can be rotated into a n-cube. The run method finds all solutions from the given start.

class toy.Strip(length)¶

Strip of cubelets that make up a single component of toy.

Parameters:length (int) – number of cubelets in strip.
Raises:ValueError – If length is not at least 2
compute_orientaion(prior_orientation)¶

compute abs orientation from orientation of previous strip abs orientation and own rel orientation using conventions.

Parameters:prior_orientation (vec) – vec of abs orientation of previous strip
get_abs_orientation()¶
Returns:absolute orientation
Return type:vec
get_coordinates()¶
Returns:list of coordinates from start to end
Return type:list
get_end()¶
Returns:end coordinate of vec
Return type:vec
get_length()¶
Returns:length
Return type:int
get_relative_orientation()¶

Increment the relative orientation

Returns:0 - 3 corresponding to the convertion convention established in the constants ORIENTATIONS, CONVERSION.
Return type:int
get_start()¶
Returns:start coordinate of vec
Return type:vec
increment_rel_orientation()¶

Increment the relative orientation

Returns:1 if increment has gone from 3 to 0, and 0 otherwise
Return type:int
set_abs_orientation(val)¶

Manually fix absolute orientation. Used on initial strips.

Parameters:val (vec) – vec or tuple of abs orientation
set_rel_orientation(val)¶

Set the relative orientation

Parameters:val (int) – 0 - 3 corresponding to the convertion convention established in the constants ORIENTATIONS, CONVERSION.
set_start(coordinate)¶

Set the start coordinate

Parameters:coordinate (vec) – vec or tuple of coordinates of start of strip
class toy.Toy(strip_lengths)¶

Toy of cublets attached by string that can be arranged into a cube.

Parameters:strip_lengths (list) – List of strip lengths
Raises:ValueError – If number of cubelets corresponding to strip_length is not a cube number.
compute_next_coordinate()¶

Compute properties of live strip from previous strip and rel orientation.

ends()¶
Returns:Coordinates of the ends of strips up to and including the current live strip
Return type:list
extend()¶

Increment rel orientations, and update live strip number appropriately, assuming NOT failed.

fail()¶

A series of conditions that if any are met mean the current state cannot lead to a solution.

Returns:0 if no immediate reason why the current state cannot reach a solution. Otherwise a positive int corresponding to the which condition failed.
Return type:int
finished()¶
Returns:1 if finished ie incrementing first strip which we have fixed to 0, 0 otherwise
Return type:int
increment()¶

Increment rel orientations, and update live strip number appropriately, assuming failed.

progress()¶

A crude progress bar: A strictly monotonic map from the current state to the interval [0,1)

rel_orientations()¶
Returns:Relative orietations of strips up to and including the current live strip
Return type:list
run(verbose=False)¶

Iterate through all states until fail. Record solutions when found.

Parameters:verbose (bool) – Print regular progress if True
solutions()¶
Returns:All solutions found in run.
Return type:list
solved()¶
Returns:1 if solved ie live strip is ultimate, and ASSUMED NOT failed, 0 otherwise
Return type:int
start(rel_orientations)¶

Fix initial rel orientations. Can then run from some given state.

Parameters:rel_orientations (list) – list of length k of ints 0 - 3 corresponding to the initial orientations of the initial k strips
toy.vec(vals)¶

Short hand for vector.
